defs: = ವೀರಸಂಸ್ತರಾರೂಢ.
= ವೀರಸ್ವರ್ಗ.
a device used by soldiers to cross the ditch around the fort.
an army of brave, courageous soldiers.
scholarship (of a person) praised by scholars.
a heaven the warriors who died in a war fighting for their state were supposed to live an eternal, happy life.
(jain.) Jina, the supreme Jaina teacher.
a householder who has lost the perpetual sacriicial fire, used in his daily sacrifice.
an armlet worn by soldiers, heros, as a mark of their valour.
a most courageous, brave, valorous man.
a valorous, heroic deed.
Vīrabhadra, a son of Śiva, who is the valour personified.
excitement of valour.
a mode of sitting (by a soldier) on one foot, and the knee of the other leg touching the ground.
a creeping plant or a low shrub.
= ವೀರುತ್ತು.
an excellent, valorous man.
Śiva.
Vīrabhadra.
befitting a valorous man.
that which is befitting a valorous man.
vigour; bravery; courageousness.
strength; power.
any of the qualities generally regarded as those that a man should have, as virility, resoluteness, honourablness, magnanimity, nobility, etc.
the thick, whitish fluid secreted by the male reproductive organs and containing the spermatozoa; the semen.
brightness; lustre.
power to produce effects or intended results; effectiveness; efficacy.
a seed of a plant, that contains the embryo.
any poisonous substance.
gold.
reputation based on brilliance of achievement, character, etc.; prestige.
(viṣṭādvaita phil.) one of the attributes of the Supreme Being.
the conduct befitting a hero.
a woman having relatively more potential to produce offsprings.
possessing vigour or might, strong; powerful.
efficacious; effective.

increase of virile energy.
ejection of semen virile.
inhibition in ejecting semen virile.
(jain.) inihibition causing a hindrance in the path of spiritual progress.
(correctly, ವಿಲ್ಲು) the legal statement oral or written, of a person's wishes concerning the disposal of his or her property after death; a will.
the document containing this;a will.
a bar, bamboo split, etc.with burdens on its both ends, carried on the shoulder.
a burden; a load.
a bringing in of corn, grain, etc. into a town (for purpose of selling).
a storing of grian, corn, etc.
a way, path, road.
an arch. coin equal to one twentieth of a Haṇa.
an arch. coin equal to one sixteenth of a Haṇa.
any of the sixteen equal parts.
a unit of weight, equal to one eight of a Maṇa or five seers.

a portion or division of a whole;a part.
(fig.) a relatively small sum of money.
(fig.) a relatively small quantity.
an official permission granting an official entry into or passage through a country; visa.

to fall - a) to drop or descend under the force of gravity, as to a lower place through loss or lack of support; b) to come or drop down suddenly to a lower position, esp. to leave a standing or erect position suddenly, whether voluntarily or not.
to bend or incline (the knee, body or head) in worship, submission or respect; to bow.
(thunder, an arrrow shot, stone pelted, etc.) to strike; to hit against.
to climb down.
to pass below the horizon; to set.
to move along in continuous contact with a smooth or slippery surface; to slide.
to jump; to leap.
to fall or cave in; crumble suddenly; to collapse.
to become tired; to get exhausted.
to cease to live; to die.

to disperse in different directions in a disorderly manner (as from fear).

to get entangled.
to fall in a continuous stream.
to fall short of becoming full, complete or a whole; to be deficient.
to be defeated; to be overpowered.
to attack; to make an assault upon.
to happen; to occur.
to hang (oneself) down loosely.
to come in contact with and become one with; to join.
to hit the target; to reach the destination.

a Vaiṣṇava monk who is died and buried (where ವೃಂದಾವನ is constructed).
any of various wild canines (esp. genera Vulpes or Urocyon) with bushy tails and, commonly, reddish-brown or gray fur; a fox.
any of several wild dogs mostly yellowish-gray in colour and smaller than the wolf; a jackal.
any of a genus (Corvus, family Corvidae) of large, nonmigratory passerine birds with glossy black plumage and a typical harsh call; a crow.

any of an order (Strigiformes) of predatory night birds distinguished by a large, flat face, eyes surrounded by stiff-feathered disks, a short, hooked beak, feathered legs with sharp talons, and soft plumage which permits noiseless flight; an owl.
(astron.) a southern constellation near the Milky Way between Centaurus and Scorpius; the Lupus; the Wolf.
the plant Zingiber cassumunnar of Zingiberaceae family.
its rhizome; cassynbar ginger.
a kind of aromatic preparation; a compounded perfume.
